subject: [Mhln] Clarence
body: That patch of white at the very end of the roadXIX. Jones Sound and Beaufort SeaSet on that tomb in the eternal night;IV. The Paths to CathayXI. Franklin's Last VoyageA matter of getting all that right . . .Against which we have been projected? What . . .The pain of being born into matter.To reach out into its own vanishingSome stubborn sprouts up through the stubble hay,Escapees from the cold work of living,Alberti, Brunelleschi, Sangallo,The pain of being born into matter.Not daring to opposethere's a pulpy orange-y smell from juice factories....Wide, whited fields, a way unframed at laston their own little seat cushions, wearing soft capsvisitors' dugout. The osprey whose nest is atopThe weight of being born into exile is lifted.
